thread.title: Alexander Hleb's Career Takes Bizarre Twist But He'll Play In $320m Stadium
thread.title_full: Alexander Hleb's Career Takes Bizarre Twist But He'll Play In $320m Stadium

title: Alexander Hleb's Career Takes Bizarre Twist But He'll Play In $320m Stadium
text:
Alexander Hleb's Career Takes Bizarre Twist But He'll Play In $320m Stadium Mon Feb 13 2017 22:45:11   22:45:11 GMT+0000 (GMT) Jack Kenmare Jack Kenmare in football 
Former Arsenal midfielder Alexander Hleb is set for yet another career move after joining Russian Premier League side FC Krylia Sovetov. 
Hleb, who has played for 10 clubs since leaving Arsenal for Barcelona in 2008, will leave Belarusian outfit BATE Borisov for Russia at the age of 35. 
After making over 130 appearances for Arsenal, Hleb revealed last year that he regretted leaving the Premier League for La Liga. He made just 19 appearances for Barcelona in a disappointing four year stay at the Nou Camp. 
10 years on from his Premier League debut, Hleb is about to join his 12th club. 
If he does manage to play in the Russian Premier League for another season, Hleb will be lucky enough to play in one of the most talked about stadiums in recent years - The Cosmos Arena. 
The Cosmos will have a capacity of 44,918 spectatorsis, and will be a major stadium in the 2018 FIFA World Cup. 
The stadium will have a 65.5 metre high dome roof, which is made up out of 32 panels. The project is expected to come at a cost of $370 million, and you can see why: 
Not bad at all.
